data.enText: a special right or advantage that a particular person or group of people has

data.chText: 教育应当是全民的权利而非某部分人特别享有的。
data.enText: Education should be a universal right and not a privilege.

data.chText: 你可以享受俱乐部成员的一切福利和优惠。
data.enText: You can enjoy all the benefits and privileges of club membership.

data.chText: （有钱有势者的）特权，特殊待遇
data.enText: the rights and advantages that rich and powerful people in a society have

data.chText: 身为贵族中的一员，他过着有钱有势的生活。
data.enText: As a member of the nobility, his life had been one of wealth and privilege.
something that you are proud and lucky to have the opportunity to do

data.chText: 但愿有幸与他们再度合作。
data.enText: I hope to have the privilege of working with them again.

data.chText: 听她唱歌真是三生有幸。
data.enText: It was a great privilege to hear her sing.
a special right to do or say things without being punished
parliamentary privilege (= the special right of members of parliament to say particular things without risking legal action)
to give sb/sth special rights or advantages that others do not have

data.chText: 特别优遇富家子弟的教育政策
data.enText: education policies that privilege the children of wealthy parents

simple_means.memory_skill: privi〔= priv〕单个 + leg 法律 + e → 有个人法律 → 特权

ex.zh: 出庭律师–当事人保密特权

tr: a special advantage or immunity or benefit not enjoyed by all
a right reserved exclusively by a particular person or group (especially a hereditary or official right)
example: suffrage was the prerogative of white adult males

tr: (law) the right to refuse to divulge information obtained in a confidential relationship

value.def: A privilege is a special right or advantage that only one person or group has.

example.ex: The Russian Federation has issued a decree abolishing special privileges for government officials.
example.tran: 俄罗斯联邦已经颁布法令废除政府官员的特权。

example.ex: ...the ancient powers and privileges of the House of Commons.
example.tran: 国会下议院古老的权力和特权

value.tran: （某人或某团体独享的）特权，优惠

value.def: If you talk about privilege, you are talking about the power and advantage that only a small group of people have, usually because of their wealth or their high social class.

example.ex: Pironi was the son of privilege and wealth, and it showed...
example.tran: 皮罗尼出身于有钱有势的豪门，这看得出来。

example.ex: Having been born to privilege in old Hollywood, she was carrying on a family tradition by acting.
example.tran: 她出身于过去好莱坞的名门，继承了当演员的家族传统。

value.tran: （常指因财富、社会地位而享有的）特权，优惠

value.def: You can use privilege in expressions such as be a privilege or have the privilege when you want to show your appreciation of someone or something or to show your respect.

example.ex: It must be a privilege to know such a man...
example.tran: 认识这样的人肯定很荣幸。

example.ex: I once had the privilege of meeting the late philosopher CLR James.
example.tran: 我曾经有幸和已故的哲学家C.L.R.詹姆士会面。

value.def: To privilege someone or something means to treat them better or differently than other people or things rather than treat them all equally.

example.ex: We want to privilege them because without the top graduate students, we can't remain a top university...
example.tran: 我们希望给予这些最顶尖的研究生特别照顾，因为没有他们，我们就无法继续处于一流大学之列。

example.ex: They are privileging a tiny number to the disadvantage of the rest.
example.tran: 他们优待少数几个人，使其他人处于不利的境地。

value.tran: 特殊对待；给予…特权；给予…优待

partsOfSpeech.dec: de 去掉 + priv 单个 + e → 从个人身边拿掉 → 剥夺
de 去掉 + priv 单个 + ation，deprive 的名词 → 剥夺
priv 单个 + acy 表性质 → 隐私
priv 单个 + ate 有…性质的 → 个人的 → 私人的
privi〔= priv〕单个 + leg 法律 + e → 有个人法律 → 特权
priv 单个 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 个人 → 私事
priv 单个 + y …的 → 私人的 → 秘密的
